tagDescription: Pacific Cable Eastern extension Australasia and China Telegraph Company Limited Proposed cable between Canada and Australia

Pacific Cable Duplication of the Pacific cable Agreement between Pacific Cable Board and Canadian Pacific Railway Company securing to Railway Company all westbound telegraph traffic carried over Imperial Cables, 1919 (see file 286, year 1923) Membership of Pacific Cable Board Bill to extend powers of Pacific Cable Board to include new telegraph and wireless system in West Indies. West India Telegraph Bill 1924 Pacific Cable Board Powers Bill Pacific Cable Bill, 1927 Imperial Wireless and Cable conference, 1928. Suggested fusion of cable and wireless Companies (see file 286) Imperial Wireless Chain agreement between South African Government and Marconis Wireless Telegraph Company, for the erection of a long distance wireless station in South Africa (see file 286) Agreement with Amalgamated Wireless (Australasia) for station in Australia

Pacific Cable  Prints Correspondence relating to the proposed construction of a cable across the Pacific Ocean, 1899-1900. Contact for the construction and laying down of the Pacific Submarine Telegraph cable, 1900 Agreement between new South Wales and Eastern Extension Company, 1901 Cable communication with Australasia. Statistics of traffic etc, 1905 Pacific Cable conference 1905, Minutes of proceeding, 1905
West African Frontier Force Comprises Military Forces of Gambia, Sierre Leon, The Gold Coast, Lagos, Northern and Southern Nigeria Includes West African constabularies

Leinster Regiment Restoration of title Prince of Whales Royal Canadian Regiment (or 100th) Establishment of a recruiting depot in Canada. Major General Huttons report on the general question of recruiting on Canada for her Majestys Forces. Particular question of recruiting for the Prince of Whales Leinster Regiment (Royal Canadians) Recruiting in Canada for the Regular Army. Conditions under which Regiment of Infantry might be raised Repatriation of Leinster Regiment. Conditions re-change of name to The 100th Prince of Whales Royal Canadian Regiment, 2 Battalions 1922: Protest against disbandment of the Prince of Whaless Leinster Regiment (Royal Canadians), in safekeeping at Royal Military College, Kingston
